title: Battle Creek woman dead after Sunday shooting
content:
A woman died Sunday in the bedroom of her house from a single gunshot wound, Battle Creek police said.
Officers were called to 23 Highway St. at 1:26 p.m. Police said the woman was shot in the left side of her body.
Paramedics from Lifecare Ambulance attempted to revive her, but she was pronounced dead at Bronson Battle Creek. An autopsy is scheduled for Monday.
Detective Sgt. Troy Gilleylen said the woman's 25-year-old boyfriend was in the bedroom when the shot was fired.
"He is saying it was on the bed and she may have laid on top of it and it discharged," Gilleylen said. "He is being questioned and has been very cooperative. We are still working on his side of what took place."
"The gun was either going to be cleaned or had just finished being cleaned," Gilleylen said.
Police have not released the names of the woman or the boyfriend.
Gilleylen said the couple lived together at the house. Two other adults and the woman's two young children were in the house at the time of the shooting. He said there is no apparent sign of a fight or argument.
"From what we know there is no history of domestic trouble and there were no signs of a struggle," he said.
He said the man has a permit to carry the handgun concealed.
"We are still working on the details," Gilleylen said. "We just don't know what to call this. Its too early to say for sure."
Contact Trace Christenson at 966-0685 or tchrist@battlecreekenquirer.com. Follow him on Twitter: @TSChristenson.
